revised_title: Generalizing Coastal Marine and Terrestrial Ecology Dynamics
tldr: The authors discuss the dynamics of coastal ecosystems, emphasizing the importance of oceanographic processes in controlling population fluctuations in marine environments. They present a study on the rocky intertidal zone, showing how recruitment levels determine the processes taking place within the ecosystem. The study also highlights the influence of offshore fronts on the population dynamics of barnacles in California.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Marine and Coastal Ecology
